qText:
She's more beautiful than Miss Tendril, even. I think she's the most
beautiful lady I've ever seen... D'you think she'd like to watch me
have my bath?
speaker: John Andrew
menEnts: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Miss Tendril'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Nanny'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr:
["What a heavenly child... I love children. That
has been my great tragedy. It was when he found I couldn't have children
that the Moulay first showed the Other Side of his Nature. It wasn't my
fault... you see my womb is out of place... I don't know why I'm
telling you all this, but I feel you'll understand. It's such a _waste
of time_, isn't it, when one knows one is going to like someone and one
goes on _pretending_... I know at once if someone is going to be a real
friend..."]
qText:
What a heavenly child... I love children. That
has been my great tragedy. It was when he found I couldn't have children
that the Moulay first showed the Other Side of his Nature. It wasn't my
fault... you see my womb is out of place... I don't know why I'm
telling you all this, but I feel you'll understand. It's such a _waste
of time_, isn't it, when one knows one is going to like someone and one
goes on _pretending_... I know at once if someone is going to be a real
friend...
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Oh, mummy,', "there's such a beautiful lady\ndownstairs. Do ask her to come and say good night. Nanny doesn't think\nshe'd want to."]
qText:
Oh, mummy, there's such a beautiful lady
downstairs. Do ask her to come and say good night. Nanny doesn't think
she'd want to.
speaker: John Andrew
menEnts: [[['Brenda']], [['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Nanny'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ['Did daddy seem to like her?']
qText: Did daddy seem to like her?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["He didn't talk much... She doesn't know anything about horses or\nnatives but she _is_ beautiful. Please tell her to come up."]
qText:
He didn't talk much... She doesn't know anything about horses or
natives but she _is_ beautiful. Please tell her to come up.
speaker: John Andrew
menEnts: [[['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ["You've made a wild success with John Andrew. He won't go\nto sleep until he's seen you again."]
qText:
You've made a wild success with John Andrew. He won't go
to sleep until he's seen you again.
speaker: Brenda
menEnts: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['John Andrew'], ['John Andrew'], ['John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ["They're both such dears."]
qText: They're both such dears.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Did you and Tony get on? I was so sorry not to be here when you\narrived.']
qText:
Did you and Tony get on? I was so sorry not to be here when you
arrived.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['He was _so_ sympathetic and gentle... and so wistful.']
qText: He was _so_ sympathetic and gentle... and so wistful.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Back to bed,', 'or I shall spank you.']
qText: Back to bed, or I shall spank you.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["Would you do it hard? I shouldn't mind."]
qText: Would you do it hard? I shouldn't mind.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['Oh dear,', "what a terrible effect you seem to have. He's\nnever like this as a rule."]
qText:
Oh dear, what a terrible effect you seem to have. He's
never like this as a rule.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Poof!', 'making the whole place stink.']
qText: Poof! making the whole place stink.
speaker: Nanny

qTextArr: ["Don't you like it? _I_ think it's lovely."]
qText: Don't you like it? _I_ think it's lovely.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["How's it going?"]
qText: How's it going?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Too soon to tell. I'm sure it will be all right."]
qText: Too soon to tell. I'm sure it will be all right.
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["She's got the wrong chap. John Andrew's mad about her... quite\nembarrassing."]
qText:
She's got the wrong chap. John Andrew's mad about her... quite
embarrassing.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["I should say Tony was a slow starter. It's a pity she's got his name\nwrong. Ought we to tell her?"]
qText:
I should say Tony was a slow starter. It's a pity she's got his name
wrong. Ought we to tell her?
speaker: Polly Cockpurse
menEnts: [[['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Tony Last'], ['Brenda', 'Polly Cockpurse'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ["No, let's leave it."]
qText: No, let's leave it.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Brenda, who _is_ this joke-woman?']
qText: Brenda, who _is_ this joke-woman?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Darling, don't you like her?"]
qText: Darling, don't you like her?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["I don't know about not liking her exactly. She's just a joke,\nisn't she?"]
qText:
I don't know about not liking her exactly. She's just a joke,
isn't she?
speaker: Tony Last
menEnts: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ["Is she... oh dear... She's had a terrible life, you know."]
qText: Is she... oh dear... She's had a terrible life, you know.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['So I gathered.']
qText: So I gathered.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Be nice to her, Tony, please.']
qText: Be nice to her, Tony, please.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Oh, I'll be nice to her. Is she a Jewess?"]
qText: Oh, I'll be nice to her. Is she a Jewess?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I don't know. I never thought. Perhaps she is."]
qText: I don't know. I never thought. Perhaps she is.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Leave the young couple to it,']
qText: Leave the young couple to it,
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["My dear, I don't believe it's going to be any good... the poor old\nboy's got _some_ taste you know, and a sense of humour."]
qText:
My dear, I don't believe it's going to be any good... the poor old
boy's got _some_ taste you know, and a sense of humour.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["She didn't show up too well at dinner, did she?"]
qText: She didn't show up too well at dinner, did she?
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["She will _go on_ so... and, after all, Tony's been used to me for\nseven years. It's rather a sudden change."]
qText:
She will _go on_ so... and, after all, Tony's been used to me for
seven years. It's rather a sudden change.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Tired?']
qText: Tired?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Mmm. Little bit.']
qText: Mmm. Little bit.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['You gave me a pretty long bout of Abdul Akbar.']
qText: You gave me a pretty long bout of Abdul Akbar.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I know. I'm sorry, darling, but Polly takes so long to get to bed...\nWas it awful? I wish you liked her more."]
qText:
I know. I'm sorry, darling, but Polly takes so long to get to bed...
Was it awful? I wish you liked her more.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["She's awful."]
qText: She's awful.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["One has to make allowances... she's got the most terrible scars."]
qText: One has to make allowances... she's got the most terrible scars.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['So she told me.']
qText: So she told me.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I've seen them."]
qText: I've seen them.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Besides, I hoped to see something of you.']
qText: Besides, I hoped to see something of you.
speaker: Tony Last

qText: Oh.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Brenda, you aren't angry still about my getting tight that night and\nwaking you up?"]
qText:
Brenda, you aren't angry still about my getting tight that night and
waking you up?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['No, sweet, do I seem angry?']
qText: No, sweet, do I seem angry?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["...I don't know. You do rather... Has it been an amusing week?"]
qText: ...I don't know. You do rather... Has it been an amusing week?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Not amusing, very hard work. Bimetallism, you know.']
qText: Not amusing, very hard work. Bimetallism, you know.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Oh, yes... well, I suppose you want to go to sleep.']
qText: Oh, yes... well, I suppose you want to go to sleep.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Mm... so tired. Good night, darling.']
qText: Mm... so tired. Good night, darling.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Good night.']
qText: Good night.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Can I go and say good morning to the Princess, mummy?']
qText: Can I go and say good morning to the Princess, mummy?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["I don't expect she's awake yet."]
qText: I don't expect she's awake yet.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Please, mummy, may I go and see? I'll just peep and, if she's asleep,\ngo away."]
qText:
Please, mummy, may I go and see? I'll just peep and, if she's asleep,
go away.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["I don't know what room she's in."]
qText: I don't know what room she's in.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Galahad, my lady,']
qText: Galahad, my lady,
speaker: Grimshawe

qTextArr: ['Oh dear, why was she put there?']
qText: Oh dear, why was she put there?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["It was Mr Last's orders, my lady."]
qText: It was Mr Last's orders, my lady.
speaker: Grimshawe

qTextArr: ["Well, she's probably awake, then."]
qText: Well, she's probably awake, then.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['May I come in?']
qText: May I come in?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['Hullo, Johnny-boy. Come in.']
qText: Hullo, Johnny-boy. Come in.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["Have you had breakfast? Mummy said you wouldn't be awake."]
qText: Have you had breakfast? Mummy said you wouldn't be awake.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["I've been awake a long time. You see I was once very badly hurt, and\nnow I don't always sleep well. Even the softest beds are too hard for me\nnow."]
qText:
I've been awake a long time. You see I was once very badly hurt, and
now I don't always sleep well. Even the softest beds are too hard for me
now.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Ooh. What did you do? Was it a motor-car accident?']
qText: Ooh. What did you do? Was it a motor-car accident?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["Not an accident, Johnny-boy, not an accident... but come in. It's cold\nwith the door open. Look, there are some grapes here. Would you like to\neat them?"]
qText:
Not an accident, Johnny-boy, not an accident... but come in. It's cold
with the door open. Look, there are some grapes here. Would you like to
eat them?
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['What are you going to do to-day?']
qText: What are you going to do to-day?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["I don't know yet. I haven't been told."]
qText: I don't know yet. I haven't been told.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr:
['Well, I'll tell you. We'll go to church in the morning because I have
to and then we'll go and look at Thunderclap and I'll show you the place
we jump and then you can come with me while I have dinner because I have
it early and afterwards we can go down to Bruton Wood and we needn't
take nanny because it makes her so muddy and you can see where they dug
out a fox in the drain just outside the wood, he nearly got away, and
then you can come and have tea in the nursery and I've got a little
gramophone Uncle Reggie gave me for Christmas and it plays "When Father
Papered the Parlour", do you know that song? Ben can sing it and I've
got some books to show you and a picture I did of the battle of Marston
Moor.']
qText:
Well, I'll tell you. We'll go to church in the morning because I have
to and then we'll go and look at Thunderclap and I'll show you the place
we jump and then you can come with me while I have dinner because I have
it early and afterwards we can go down to Bruton Wood and we needn't
take nanny because it makes her so muddy and you can see where they dug
out a fox in the drain just outside the wood, he nearly got away, and
then you can come and have tea in the nursery and I've got a little
gramophone Uncle Reggie gave me for Christmas and it plays "When Father
Papered the Parlour", do you know that song? Ben can sing it and I've
got some books to show you and a picture I did of the battle of Marston
Moor.
speaker: John Andrew
menEnts: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Nanny'], ['Nanny'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Reggie'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Ben'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ["I think that sounds a lovely day. But don't you think I ought to spend\nsome time with daddy and mummy and Lady Cockpurse?"]
qText:
I think that sounds a lovely day. But don't you think I ought to spend
some time with daddy and mummy and Lady Cockpurse?
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["Oh, _them_... besides, it's all my foot about Lady Cockpurse having a\ntail. Please, you _will_ spend the day with me?"]
qText:
Oh, _them_... besides, it's all my foot about Lady Cockpurse having a
tail. Please, you _will_ spend the day with me?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["Well, we'll see."]
qText: Well, we'll see.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["She's gone to church with him. That's a good sign, isn't it?"]
qText: She's gone to church with him. That's a good sign, isn't it?
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["Well, not really, Polly. He likes going alone, or with me. It's the\ntime he gossips to the village."]
qText:
Well, not really, Polly. He likes going alone, or with me. It's the
time he gossips to the village.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["She won't stop him."]
qText: She won't stop him.
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["I'm afraid you don't understand the old boy altogether. He's much odder\nthan you'd think."]
qText:
I'm afraid you don't understand the old boy altogether. He's much odder
than you'd think.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['I could see from your sermon that you knew the East, Rector.']
qText: I could see from your sermon that you knew the East, Rector.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Yes, yes, most of my life.']
qText: Yes, yes, most of my life.
speaker: The Vicar

qTextArr: ["It has an uncanny fascination, hasn't it?"]
qText: It has an uncanny fascination, hasn't it?
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Oh, come on,', 'We must go and see\nThunderclap.']
qText:
Oh, come on, We must go and see
Thunderclap.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["Why don't you show Jenny the house?"]
qText: Why don't you show Jenny the house?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Oh yes, _do_.']
qText: Oh yes, _do_.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["Brenda's having it done\nup."]
qText:
Brenda's having it done
up.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Oh, Teddy, what a shame. I do hate seeing things modernized.']
qText: Oh, Teddy, what a shame. I do hate seeing things modernized.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["It isn't a room we used very much."]
qText: It isn't a room we used very much.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['No, but still...']
qText: No, but still...
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr:
["You know, Brenda's been a wonderful friend to me. I
wouldn't say anything against her... but ever since I came here I've
been wondering whether she really understands this beautiful place and
all it means to you."]
qText:
You know, Brenda's been a wonderful friend to me. I
wouldn't say anything against her... but ever since I came here I've
been wondering whether she really understands this beautiful place and
all it means to you.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Tell me more about your terrible life,']
qText: Tell me more about your terrible life,
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You _are_ shy of talking about yourself, aren't you, Teddy? It's a\nmistake, you know, to keep things bottled up. I've been very unhappy\ntoo."]
qText:
You _are_ shy of talking about yourself, aren't you, Teddy? It's a
mistake, you know, to keep things bottled up. I've been very unhappy
too.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ['Oh,\nthere you are,', "Come on. We're going down\nto the woods now. We must hurry, otherwise it will be dark."]
qText:
Oh,
there you are, Come on. We're going down
to the woods now. We must hurry, otherwise it will be dark.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['Oh, Johnny-boy, must I really? I was just talking to daddy.']
qText: Oh, Johnny-boy, must I really? I was just talking to daddy.
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

qTextArr: ["_Come on._ It's all arranged. And afterwards you're to be allowed to\nhave tea with me upstairs."]
qText:
_Come on._ It's all arranged. And afterwards you're to be allowed to
have tea with me upstairs.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['_Tony_, here all alone?\nWe thought you were with Jenny. What have you done with her?']
qText:
_Tony_, here all alone?
We thought you were with Jenny. What have you done with her?
speaker: Brenda
menEnts: [[['Tony Last'], ['Brenda', 'Polly Cockpurse'], ['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

qTextArr: ['John took her off... just in time before I said something rude.']
qText: John took her off... just in time before I said something rude.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Oh dear... well there's only me and Polly in the smoking-room. Come\nand have some tea. You look all funny--have you been asleep?"]
qText:
Oh dear... well there's only me and Polly in the smoking-room. Come
and have some tea. You look all funny--have you been asleep?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['We must write it down a failure, definitely.']
qText: We must write it down a failure, definitely.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["What _does_ the old boy expect? It isn't as though he was everybody's\nmoney."]
qText:
What _does_ the old boy expect? It isn't as though he was everybody's
money.
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["I daresay it would have been all right, if she hadn't got his name\nwrong."]
qText:
I daresay it would have been all right, if she hadn't got his name
wrong.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Anyway, this lets _you_ out. You've done far more than most wives would\nto cheer the old boy up."]
qText:
Anyway, this lets _you_ out. You've done far more than most wives would
to cheer the old boy up.
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

qTextArr: ["Yes, that's certainly true,"]
qText: Yes, that's certainly true,
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["I shan't be here\nnext week-end,", "I'm going to stay with Veronica."]
qText:
I shan't be here
next week-end, I'm going to stay with Veronica.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Am I asked?']
qText: Am I asked?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Well, you _were_, of course, but I refused for you. You know you always\nhate staying away.']
qText:
Well, you _were_, of course, but I refused for you. You know you always
hate staying away.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["I wouldn't mind coming."]
qText: I wouldn't mind coming.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Oh, darling, I wish I'd known. Veronica would have loved it so... but\nI'm afraid it will be too late now. She's only got a tiny house... to\ntell you the truth I didn't think you liked her much."]
qText:
Oh, darling, I wish I'd known. Veronica would have loved it so... but
I'm afraid it will be too late now. She's only got a tiny house... to
tell you the truth I didn't think you liked her much.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['I hated her like hell.']
qText: I hated her like hell.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Well, then...?']
qText: Well, then...?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Oh, it doesn't matter. I suppose you must go back on Monday? The hounds\nare meeting on Wednesday, you know."]
qText:
Oh, it doesn't matter. I suppose you must go back on Monday? The hounds
are meeting on Wednesday, you know.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Are we giving them a lawner?']
qText: Are we giving them a lawner?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Yes, darling, you know we do every year.']
qText: Yes, darling, you know we do every year.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['So we do.']
qText: So we do.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["You couldn't stay down till then?"]
qText: You couldn't stay down till then?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Not possibly, darling. You see if I miss one lecture I get right behind\nand can't follow the next. Besides, I am not mad keen to see the\nhounds."]
qText:
Not possibly, darling. You see if I miss one lecture I get right behind
and can't follow the next. Besides, I am not mad keen to see the
hounds.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Ben was asking if we'd let John go out."]
qText: Ben was asking if we'd let John go out.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Oh, he's far too young."]
qText: Oh, he's far too young.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Not to hunt. But I thought he might bring his pony to the meet and ride\nwith them to the first covert. He'd love it so."]
qText:
Not to hunt. But I thought he might bring his pony to the meet and ride
with them to the first covert. He'd love it so.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Is it quite safe?']
qText: Is it quite safe?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Oh, yes, surely?']
qText: Oh, yes, surely?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Bless his heart, I wish I could be here to see him.']
qText: Bless his heart, I wish I could be here to see him.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Do change your mind.']
qText: Do change your mind.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Oh no, that's quite out of the question. Don't make a thing about it,\nTony."]
qText:
Oh no, that's quite out of the question. Don't make a thing about it,
Tony.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["The old boy's happy as a lark,", "He's settling down wonderfully to the new r?gime."]
qText: The old boy's happy as a lark, He's settling down wonderfully to the new r?gime.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Tony nearly had one through the window,']
qText: Tony nearly had one through the window,
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Everything _is_ all right, isn't it?"]
qText: Everything _is_ all right, isn't it?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Yes, of course, darling.']
qText: Yes, of course, darling.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['I get depressed down here all alone and imagine things.']
qText: I get depressed down here all alone and imagine things.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You aren't to _brood_, Tony. You know that's one of the things that\naren't allowed."]
qText:
You aren't to _brood_, Tony. You know that's one of the things that
aren't allowed.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["I won't brood any more,"]
qText: I won't brood any more,
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['And how are the abstruse sciences, Lady Brenda?']
qText: And how are the abstruse sciences, Lady Brenda?
speaker: The Vicar

qTextArr: ['Absorbing.']
qText: Absorbing.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['We shall all be coming to you for advice about our overdrafts.']
qText: We shall all be coming to you for advice about our overdrafts.
speaker: The Vicar

qTextArr: ['Ha, ha.']
qText: Ha, ha.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["And how's Thunderclap?"]
qText: And how's Thunderclap?
speaker: Miss Tendril

qTextArr: ["I'm taking her out hunting on Wednesday,"]
qText: I'm taking her out hunting on Wednesday,
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr:
["Please God
make there be a good scent. Please God make me see the kill. Please God
don't let me do anything wrong. God bless Ben and Thunderclap. Please
God make me jump an enormous great oxer,"]
qText:
Please God
make there be a good scent. Please God make me see the kill. Please God
don't let me do anything wrong. God bless Ben and Thunderclap. Please
God make me jump an enormous great oxer,
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["We've got the hounds meeting at Hetton on Wednesday. Couldn't you\nstay down till then?"]
qText:
We've got the hounds meeting at Hetton on Wednesday. Couldn't you
stay down till then?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Must be back. There's going to be a debate on the Pig Scheme."]
qText: Must be back. There's going to be a debate on the Pig Scheme.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["I wish you'd stay. Look here, why don't you ask that girl down?\nEveryone goes to-morrow. You could ring her up, couldn't you?"]
qText:
I wish you'd stay. Look here, why don't you ask that girl down?
Everyone goes to-morrow. You could ring her up, couldn't you?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['I _could_.']
qText: I _could_.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Would she hate it? She could have Lyonesse--Polly slept there two\nweek-ends running, so it can't be too uncomfortable."]
qText:
Would she hate it? She could have Lyonesse--Polly slept there two
week-ends running, so it can't be too uncomfortable.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["She'd probably love it. I'll ring up and ask her."]
qText: She'd probably love it. I'll ring up and ask her.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Why don't you hunt too? There's a chap called Brinkwell who's got some\nquite decent hirelings, I believe."]
qText:
Why don't you hunt too? There's a chap called Brinkwell who's got some
quite decent hirelings, I believe.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Yes, I might.']
qText: Yes, I might.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Jock's staying on. He's having the Shameless Blonde down. You don't\nmind?"]
qText:
Jock's staying on. He's having the Shameless Blonde down. You don't
mind?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Me? Of course not.']
qText: Me? Of course not.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['This _has_ been a jolly week-end.']
qText: This _has_ been a jolly week-end.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['I thought you were enjoying it.']
qText: I thought you were enjoying it.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Just like old times--before the economics began.']
qText: Just like old times--before the economics began.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["D'you think Tony knows about Mr Beaver?"]
qText: D'you think Tony knows about Mr Beaver?
speaker: Marjorie

qTextArr: ['Not a thing.']
qText: Not a thing.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["I haven't mentioned it to Allan. D'you suppose he knows?"]
qText: I haven't mentioned it to Allan. D'you suppose he knows?
speaker: Marjorie

qTextArr: ['I doubt it.']
qText: I doubt it.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Oh, Jock, how d'you think it'll end?"]
qText: Oh, Jock, how d'you think it'll end?
speaker: Marjorie

qTextArr: ["She'll get bored with Beaver soon enough."]
qText: She'll get bored with Beaver soon enough.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["The trouble is that he doesn't care for her in the least. If he did, it\nwould soon be over... What an ass she is being."]
qText:
The trouble is that he doesn't care for her in the least. If he did, it
would soon be over... What an ass she is being.
speaker: Marjorie

qTextArr: ['I should say she was managing it unusually well, if you ask me.']
qText: I should say she was managing it unusually well, if you ask me.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["D'you think Marjorie and\nAllan know about Brenda?"]
qText:
D'you think Marjorie and
Allan know about Brenda?
speaker: Unknowable
refExp: The other married couple said to each other

qTextArr: ["I'm sure they don't."]
qText: I'm sure they don't.
speaker: Unknowable

qTextArr: ["Tony's as happy as a sandboy, isn't he?"]
qText: Tony's as happy as a sandboy, isn't he?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Full of beans.']
qText: Full of beans.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ["I was getting worried about him... You don't think he's got any idea\nabout my goings on?"]
qText:
I was getting worried about him... You don't think he's got any idea
about my goings on?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Lord no. It's the last thing that would come into his head."]
qText: Lord no. It's the last thing that would come into his head.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ["I don't want him to be unhappy, you know... Marjorie's\nbeen frightfully governessy about the whole thing."]
qText:
I don't want him to be unhappy, you know... Marjorie's
been frightfully governessy about the whole thing.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["Has she? I haven't discussed it with her."]
qText: Has she? I haven't discussed it with her.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ['How did _you_ hear?']
qText: How did _you_ hear?
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ["My dear girl, until this minute I didn't know you had any goings on.\nAnd I'm not asking any questions about them now."]
qText:
My dear girl, until this minute I didn't know you had any goings on.
And I'm not asking any questions about them now.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ['Oh... I thought everyone knew.']
qText: Oh... I thought everyone knew.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr:
["That's always the trouble with people when they start walking out. They
either think no one knows, or everybody. The truth is that a few people
like Polly and Sybil make a point of finding out about everyone's
private life; the rest of us just aren't interested."]
qText:
That's always the trouble with people when they start walking out. They
either think no one knows, or everybody. The truth is that a few people
like Polly and Sybil make a point of finding out about everyone's
private life; the rest of us just aren't interested.
speaker: Allan

qText: Oh.
speaker: Brenda

qTextArr: ['Brenda tried to be confidential about Beaver\nthis evening.']
qText:
Brenda tried to be confidential about Beaver
this evening.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ["I didn't know you knew."]
qText: I didn't know you knew.
speaker: Marjorie

qTextArr: ["Oh, I knew all right. But I wasn't going to let her feel important by\ntalking about it."]
qText:
Oh, I knew all right. But I wasn't going to let her feel important by
talking about it.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ["I couldn't disapprove more of the whole thing. Do you know Beaver?"]
qText: I couldn't disapprove more of the whole thing. Do you know Beaver?
speaker: Marjorie

qTextArr: ["I've seen him about. Anyway, it's her business and Tony's, not ours."]
qText: I've seen him about. Anyway, it's her business and Tony's, not ours.
speaker: Allan

qTextArr: ['Forty-two minutes,', 'not at all bad with the\nwind against me.']
qText:
Forty-two minutes, not at all bad with the
wind against me.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Are you going to hunt on Wednesday?', "They're meeting here,\nyou know."]
qText:
Are you going to hunt on Wednesday? They're meeting here,
you know.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["I might go out for half the day, if I can find a horse. It'll be the\nfirst time this year."]
qText:
I might go out for half the day, if I can find a horse. It'll be the
first time this year.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["It's my first time too."]
qText: It's my first time too.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['We shall both be terribly stiff.']
qText: We shall both be terribly stiff.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["You'll have to show me the country."]
qText: You'll have to show me the country.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I expect they'll draw Bruton Wood first. There's a big fox there, daddy\nand I saw him."]
qText:
I expect they'll draw Bruton Wood first. There's a big fox there, daddy
and I saw him.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["It's delightful your coming\ndown. What d'you think of Tony?"]
qText:
It's delightful your coming
down. What d'you think of Tony?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['Is he married to that rather lovely woman we saw at the Caf? de Paris?']
qText: Is he married to that rather lovely woman we saw at the Caf? de Paris?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qText: Yes.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['The one you said was in love with that young man?']
qText: The one you said was in love with that young man?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qText: Yes.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Funny of her... What's this one's name again?"]
qText: Funny of her... What's this one's name again?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["Tony Last. It's a pretty ghastly house, isn't it?"]
qText: Tony Last. It's a pretty ghastly house, isn't it?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['Is it? I never notice houses much.']
qText: Is it? I never notice houses much.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["Don't wait up for me,", 'I shall stay here until it comes out.\nIt often takes several hours.']
qText:
Don't wait up for me, I shall stay here until it comes out.
It often takes several hours.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Have you got any pigs at the farm?']
qText: Have you got any pigs at the farm?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qText: Yes.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Would you mind if I went to see them?']
qText: Would you mind if I went to see them?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['Not in the least--but why?']
qText: Not in the least--but why?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['And is there a man who looks after them, who will be able to explain\nabout them?']
qText:
And is there a man who looks after them, who will be able to explain
about them?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qText: Yes.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Well, I think I'll spend the morning with him. I've got to make a\nspeech about pigs, fairly soon."]
qText:
Well, I think I'll spend the morning with him. I've got to make a
speech about pigs, fairly soon.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['I was down\nearly,', "and found the men at work stripping the ceiling.\nI couldn't resist joining in. I hope you don't mind."]
qText:
I was down
early, and found the men at work stripping the ceiling.
I couldn't resist joining in. I hope you don't mind.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["If I'm in at the death I expect Colonel Inch will blood\nme."]
qText:
If I'm in at the death I expect Colonel Inch will blood
me.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["You won't see any death,"]
qText: You won't see any death,
speaker: Nanny

qTextArr: ['He can ride with them as far as the covert,']
qText: He can ride with them as far as the covert,
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Yes, sir, and there'd be no harm in his stayin' a bit to see hounds\nworking, would there?"]
qText:
Yes, sir, and there'd be no harm in his stayin' a bit to see hounds
working, would there?
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ['No, I suppose not.']
qText: No, I suppose not.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["And if he breaks away towards home, there'd be no harm in our following\na bit, if we keeps to the lanes and gates, would there, sir?"]
qText:
And if he breaks away towards home, there'd be no harm in our following
a bit, if we keeps to the lanes and gates, would there, sir?
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["No, but he's not to stay out more than an hour."]
qText: No, but he's not to stay out more than an hour.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You wouldn't have me take him home with hounds running, would you,\nsir?"]
qText:
You wouldn't have me take him home with hounds running, would you,
sir?
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["Well, he's got to be in before one."]
qText: Well, he's got to be in before one.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I'll see to that, sir. Don't you worry, my beauty,", "you'll get a hunt right enough."]
qText: I'll see to that, sir. Don't you worry, my beauty, you'll get a hunt right enough.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ['Hold on to her, son']
qText: Hold on to her, son
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["I'm afraid I'm riding very badly to-day. D'you think anyone has\nnoticed?"]
qText:
I'm afraid I'm riding very badly to-day. D'you think anyone has
noticed?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["That's all right, son. You can't keep riding-school manners when you're\nhunting."]
qText:
That's all right, son. You can't keep riding-school manners when you're
hunting.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ['I rather like this absurd\nhorse,']
qText:
I rather like this absurd
horse,
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['That girl will come to no good,']
qText: That girl will come to no good,
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["What's happening, Mr Grant-Menzies?"]
qText: What's happening, Mr Grant-Menzies?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['Hounds are drawing the covert.']
qText: Hounds are drawing the covert.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qText: Oh.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['Are you enjoying yourself?']
qText: Are you enjoying yourself?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Oh, yes. Thunderclap's terribly fresh. I've never known her like this."]
qText: Oh, yes. Thunderclap's terribly fresh. I've never known her like this.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["They're calling hounds\noff."]
qText:
They're calling hounds
off.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Does that mean it's a blank?"]
qText: Does that mean it's a blank?
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["I'm afraid so."]
qText: I'm afraid so.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['I hate this happening in _our_ woods,', 'Looks bad.']
qText: I hate this happening in _our_ woods, Looks bad.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["D'you think I ought to take the young gentleman home,\nsir?"]
qText:
D'you think I ought to take the young gentleman home,
sir?
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ['What did Mr Last say?']
qText: What did Mr Last say?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["He said he could go as far as the covert. He didn't say which, sir."]
qText: He said he could go as far as the covert. He didn't say which, sir.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["I'm afraid it sounds as if he ought to go."]
qText: I'm afraid it sounds as if he ought to go.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['_Oh, Mr Menzies!_']
qText: _Oh, Mr Menzies!_
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["Yes, come along, Master John. You've had enough for to-day."]
qText: Yes, come along, Master John. You've had enough for to-day.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["But I haven't had _any_."]
qText: But I haven't had _any_.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ['If you come back in good time to-day your dad will be all the more\nwilling to let you come out another day.']
qText:
If you come back in good time to-day your dad will be all the more
willing to let you come out another day.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["But there mayn't _be_ another day. The world may come to an end.\n_Please_, Ben. _Please_, Mr Menzies."]
qText:
But there mayn't _be_ another day. The world may come to an end.
_Please_, Ben. _Please_, Mr Menzies.
speaker: John Andrew

qTextArr: ["It is a shame they shouldn't have found,", "He's been looking\nforward to it."]
qText:
It is a shame they shouldn't have found, He's been looking
forward to it.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ['Still, I think Mr Last would want him to go back,']
qText: Still, I think Mr Last would want him to go back,
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['Look,', "Here comes Miss Ripon on that nappy\nbay. Seems as if she's going in, too. Had a fall by the looks of her."]
qText:
Look, Here comes Miss Ripon on that nappy
bay. Seems as if she's going in, too. Had a fall by the looks of her.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr:
["I'm taking him away,", "I can't do anything with him this morning.", "I thought perhaps Mr Last would let me
come up to the house and telephone for the car. I don't feel like
hacking him home in his present state. I can't think what's come over
him,", "He was out on Saturday. I've never known him
like this before."]
qText:
I'm taking him away, I can't do anything with him this morning. I thought perhaps Mr Last would let me
come up to the house and telephone for the car. I don't feel like
hacking him home in his present state. I can't think what's come over
him, He was out on Saturday. I've never known him
like this before.
speaker: Miss Ripon

qTextArr: ['He wants a man up,']
qText: He wants a man up,
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["Oh, he's no better with the groom, and daddy won't go near him,", "At least... I mean... I don't\nthink that they'd be any better with him in this state."]
qText:
Oh, he's no better with the groom, and daddy won't go near him, At least... I mean... I don't
think that they'd be any better with him in this state.
speaker: Miss Ripon

qTextArr: ["Let me go first, Miss. He'll follow. Don't hold too hard on\nhis mouth and just give him a tap."]
qText:
Let me go first, Miss. He'll follow. Don't hold too hard on
his mouth and just give him a tap.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ['Take a hold of him, Miss. Use your whip,']
qText: Take a hold of him, Miss. Use your whip,
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["The boy's down."]
qText: The boy's down.
speaker: Miss Ripon

qTextArr: ["It's the most appalling thing,", 'What on\nearth are we going to say to Tony?']
qText:
It's the most appalling thing, What on
earth are we going to say to Tony?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["I'm the last person to have about on an occasion like this,"]
qText: I'm the last person to have about on an occasion like this,
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Killed instantly,', 'Took it full on the base of the skull.\nVery sad, awfully fond of the kid. No one to blame, though.']
qText:
Killed instantly, Took it full on the base of the skull.
Very sad, awfully fond of the kid. No one to blame, though.
speaker: The Doctor

qTextArr: ["It wasn't the kid's fault,"]
qText: It wasn't the kid's fault,
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["It wasn't anyone's fault,"]
qText: It wasn't anyone's fault,
speaker: Unknowable

qTextArr: ["He'd had a lousy day, too, poor little bastard,"]
qText: He'd had a lousy day, too, poor little bastard,
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["If it was anyone's fault it was Mr Grant-Menzies making him go in."]
qText: If it was anyone's fault it was Mr Grant-Menzies making him go in.
speaker: Ben

qTextArr: ["It wasn't anyone's fault,"]
qText: It wasn't anyone's fault,
speaker: Unknowable

qTextArr: ["We've got to tell Brenda."]
qText: We've got to tell Brenda.
speaker: Tony Last
refExp: he said when Jock came in was

qTextArr: ["D'you know where to get her?"]
qText: D'you know where to get her?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["She's probably at that school... But we can't tell her over the\ntelephone... Anyway, Ambrose has tried there and the flat but he can't\nget through... What on earth are we going to say to her?"]
qText:
She's probably at that school... But we can't tell her over the
telephone... Anyway, Ambrose has tried there and the flat but he can't
get through... What on earth are we going to say to her?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You\nweren't anywhere near, were you?"]
qText:
You
weren't anywhere near, were you?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["No, we'd gone on to another covert."]
qText: No, we'd gone on to another covert.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["That niece of Mr Tendril's told me first... then we met them coming\nup, and Ben told me all that happened... It's awful for the girl."]
qText:
That niece of Mr Tendril's told me first... then we met them coming
up, and Ben told me all that happened... It's awful for the girl.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Miss Ripon?']
qText: Miss Ripon?
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr:
["Yes, she's just left... she had a nasty fall too, just after. Her
horse slipped up in the village... she was in a terrible state, poor
child, what with that and... John. She didn't know she'd hurt him until
quite a time afterwards... she was in the chemist's shop having a
bandage put on her head, when they told her. She cut it falling. She was
in a terrible state. I sent her back in the car... it wasn't her
fault."]
qText:
Yes, she's just left... she had a nasty fall too, just after. Her
horse slipped up in the village... she was in a terrible state, poor
child, what with that and... John. She didn't know she'd hurt him until
quite a time afterwards... she was in the chemist's shop having a
bandage put on her head, when they told her. She cut it falling. She was
in a terrible state. I sent her back in the car... it wasn't her
fault.
speaker: Tony Last
menEnts: [[['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['John Andrew'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['John Andrew'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon']]]

qTextArr: ["No, it wasn't anybody's fault. It just happened."]
qText: No, it wasn't anybody's fault. It just happened.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["That's it,", 'It just happened... how are we going to tell\nBrenda?']
qText:
That's it, It just happened... how are we going to tell
Brenda?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['One of us will have to go up.']
qText: One of us will have to go up.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ["Yes... I think I shall have to stay here. I don't know why really,\nbut there will be things to see to. It's an awful thing to ask anyone\nto do..."]
qText:
Yes... I think I shall have to stay here. I don't know why really,
but there will be things to see to. It's an awful thing to ask anyone
to do...
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I'll go,"]
qText: I'll go,
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr:
["There'll be things to see to there... there's got to be an inquest the
doctor says. It's purely formal, of course, but it will be ghastly for
that Ripon girl. She'll have to give evidence... she was in a terrible
state. I hope I was all right to her. They'd just brought John in and I
was rather muddled. She looked awful. I believe her father's bloody to
her... I wish Brenda had been here. She's so good with everyone. I get
in a muddle."]
qText:
There'll be things to see to there... there's got to be an inquest the
doctor says. It's purely formal, of course, but it will be ghastly for
that Ripon girl. She'll have to give evidence... she was in a terrible
state. I hope I was all right to her. They'd just brought John in and I
was rather muddled. She looked awful. I believe her father's bloody to
her... I wish Brenda had been here. She's so good with everyone. I get
in a muddle.
speaker: Tony Last
menEnts: [[['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['John Andrew'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Brenda'], ['Brenda']]]

qTextArr: ['Can you really face going up\nand seeing Brenda?']
qText:
Can you really face going up
and seeing Brenda?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Yes, I'll go,"]
qText: Yes, I'll go,
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['Colonel Inch has been here,', 'I talked to him. He wanted to give you his sympathy.']
qText: Colonel Inch has been here, I talked to him. He wanted to give you his sympathy.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Is he still here?']
qText: Is he still here?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["No, I told him you'd probably prefer to be left alone. He thought you'd\nbe glad to hear he stopped the hunt."]
qText:
No, I told him you'd probably prefer to be left alone. He thought you'd
be glad to hear he stopped the hunt.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Nice of him to come... Were you having a good day?']
qText: Nice of him to come... Were you having a good day?
speaker: Tony Last

qText: No.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I'm sorry. We saw a fox in Bruton Wood last week. John and I... Jock's\ngoing up to London to fetch Brenda."]
qText:
I'm sorry. We saw a fox in Bruton Wood last week. John and I... Jock's
going up to London to fetch Brenda.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I'll take him in the aeroplane. It'll be quicker."]
qText: I'll take him in the aeroplane. It'll be quicker.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Yes, that will be quicker.']
qText: Yes, that will be quicker.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I'll go and change now. I won't be ten minutes."]
qText: I'll go and change now. I won't be ten minutes.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I'll change, too,"]
qText: I'll change, too,
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

qTextArr: ['Will you tell Mr Ambrose that Mrs Rattery is leaving to-day. She is\nflying up with Mr Grant-Menzies. Her ladyship will probably be coming by\nthe evening train.']
qText:
Will you tell Mr Ambrose that Mrs Rattery is leaving to-day. She is
flying up with Mr Grant-Menzies. Her ladyship will probably be coming by
the evening train.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Very good, sir.']
qText: Very good, sir.
speaker: The Footman

qTextArr:
["They had better have some luncheon before they go. I will have it with
them... And will you put a call through to Colonel Inch and thank him
for coming? Say I will write. And to Mr Ripon's to enquire how Miss
Ripon is? And to the vicarage and ask Mr Tendril if I can see him this
evening? He's not here still?"]
qText:
They had better have some luncheon before they go. I will have it with
them... And will you put a call through to Colonel Inch and thank him
for coming? Say I will write. And to Mr Ripon's to enquire how Miss
Ripon is? And to the vicarage and ask Mr Tendril if I can see him this
evening? He's not here still?
speaker: Tony Last
menEnts: [[['Jock Grant-Menzies'], ['Jock Grant-Menzies'], ['Mrs Rattery', 'Jock Grant-Menzies'], ['The Footman'], ['Colonel Inch'], ['Colonel Inch'], ['Mr Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Mr Tendril'], ['Mr Tendril'], ['Mr Tendril']]]

qTextArr: ['No, sir, he left a few minutes ago.']
qText: No, sir, he left a few minutes ago.
speaker: The Footman

qTextArr: ['Tell him I shall have to discuss arrangements with him.']
qText: Tell him I shall have to discuss arrangements with him.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Very good, sir.']
qText: Very good, sir.
speaker: The Footman

qTextArr: ["They're just getting luncheon."]
qText: They're just getting luncheon.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["We shan't want any,", 'You forget we were going hunting.']
qText: We shan't want any, You forget we were going hunting.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Better have something,', "It's awful for Jock,\nhaving to tell Brenda. I wonder how long it will be before she arrives."]
qText:
Better have something, It's awful for Jock,
having to tell Brenda. I wonder how long it will be before she arrives.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["What are you going to do while you're waiting?"]
qText: What are you going to do while you're waiting?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I don't know. I suppose there will be things to see to."]
qText: I don't know. I suppose there will be things to see to.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Look here,', "Jock had better go up by car. I'll stay\nhere until Lady Brenda comes."]
qText:
Look here, Jock had better go up by car. I'll stay
here until Lady Brenda comes.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['It would be awful for you.']
qText: It would be awful for you.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["No, I'll stay."]
qText: No, I'll stay.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I suppose it's ridiculous of me, but I wish you would... I\nmean, won't it be awful for you? I am all in a muddle. It's so hard to\nbelieve yet that it really happened."]
qText:
I suppose it's ridiculous of me, but I wish you would... I
mean, won't it be awful for you? I am all in a muddle. It's so hard to
believe yet that it really happened.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['It happened all right.']
qText: It happened all right.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Mr Grant-Menzies is going up in his car. He may be back to-night,', 'Mrs Rattery is waiting until her ladyship arrives.']
qText: Mr Grant-Menzies is going up in his car. He may be back to-night, Mrs Rattery is waiting until her ladyship arrives.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Very good, sir. And Colonel Inch wanted to know whether you would care\nto have the huntsmen blow "Gone to ground" at the funeral.']
qText:
Very good, sir. And Colonel Inch wanted to know whether you would care
to have the huntsmen blow "Gone to ground" at the funeral.
speaker: The Footman

qTextArr: ["Say that I'll write to him,"]
qText: Say that I'll write to him,
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['An atrocious suggestion.']
qText: An atrocious suggestion.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Oh, I don't know. He's very anxious to be helpful."]
qText: Oh, I don't know. He's very anxious to be helpful.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["They don't like him much as Master."]
qText: They don't like him much as Master.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I'm afraid this is a very difficult situation,", 'After all\nwe scarcely know each other.']
qText:
I'm afraid this is a very difficult situation, After all
we scarcely know each other.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You don't have to think about me."]
qText: You don't have to think about me.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['But it must be awful for you.']
qText: But it must be awful for you.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['And you must stop thinking that.']
qText: And you must stop thinking that.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I'll try... the absurd thing is that I'm not thinking it, just saying\nit... I keep thinking of other things all the time."]
qText:
I'll try... the absurd thing is that I'm not thinking it, just saying
it... I keep thinking of other things all the time.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I know. You don't have to say anything."]
qText: I know. You don't have to say anything.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr:
["It's going to be so much worse for Brenda. You see
she'd got nothing else, much, except John. I've got her, and I love the
house... but with Brenda John always came first... naturally... And
then you know she's seen so little of John lately. She's been in London
such a lot. I'm afraid that's going to hurt her."]
qText:
It's going to be so much worse for Brenda. You see
she'd got nothing else, much, except John. I've got her, and I love the
house... but with Brenda John always came first... naturally... And
then you know she's seen so little of John lately. She's been in London
such a lot. I'm afraid that's going to hurt her.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You can't ever tell what's going to hurt people."]
qText: You can't ever tell what's going to hurt people.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['But, you see, I know Brenda so well.']
qText: But, you see, I know Brenda so well.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Only four o'clock?"]
qText: Only four o'clock?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['I thought you were asleep.']
qText: I thought you were asleep.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['No, just thinking... Jock will be more than half-way there by now,\nabout Aylesbury or Tring.']
qText:
No, just thinking... Jock will be more than half-way there by now,
about Aylesbury or Tring.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["It's a slow way to travel."]
qText: It's a slow way to travel.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["It's less than four hours ago that it happened... it's odd to think\nthat this is the same day; that it's only five hours ago they were all\nhere at the meet having drinks."]
qText:
It's less than four hours ago that it happened... it's odd to think
that this is the same day; that it's only five hours ago they were all
here at the meet having drinks.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr:
["It was twenty-eight
minutes past twelve when I heard. I looked at my watch... It was ten to
one when they brought John in... just over three hours ago... It's
almost incredible, isn't it, everything becoming absolutely different,
suddenly like that?"]
qText:
It was twenty-eight
minutes past twelve when I heard. I looked at my watch... It was ten to
one when they brought John in... just over three hours ago... It's
almost incredible, isn't it, everything becoming absolutely different,
suddenly like that?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["It's always that way,"]
qText: It's always that way,
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr:
["Brenda will hear in an hour now... if Jock finds her in. Of course she
may very likely be out. He won't know where to find her, because there's
no one else in the flat. She leaves it locked up, empty, when she goes
out... and she's out half the day. I know because I sometimes ring up
and can't get an answer. He may not find her for hours... It may be as
long again as the time since it happened. That would only make it eight
o'clock. It's quite likely she won't come in until eight... Think of
it, all the time between now and when it happened, before Brenda hears.
It's scarcely credible, is it? And then she's got to get down here.
There's a train that leaves at nine something. She might get that. I
wonder if I ought to have gone up too... I didn't like to leave John."]
qText:
Brenda will hear in an hour now... if Jock finds her in. Of course she
may very likely be out. He won't know where to find her, because there's
no one else in the flat. She leaves it locked up, empty, when she goes
out... and she's out half the day. I know because I sometimes ring up
and can't get an answer. He may not find her for hours... It may be as
long again as the time since it happened. That would only make it eight
o'clock. It's quite likely she won't come in until eight... Think of
it, all the time between now and when it happened, before Brenda hears.
It's scarcely credible, is it? And then she's got to get down here.
There's a train that leaves at nine something. She might get that. I
wonder if I ought to have gone up too... I didn't like to leave John.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr:
["...Of course she may be at home when he arrives. In that case she can
get the evening train she used always to come by, when she went to
London for the day, before she got the flat... I'm trying to see it
all, as it's going to happen, Jock coming and her surprise at seeing
him, and then his telling her... It's awful for Jock... She may know
at half-past five or a bit earlier."]
qText:
...Of course she may be at home when he arrives. In that case she can
get the evening train she used always to come by, when she went to
London for the day, before she got the flat... I'm trying to see it
all, as it's going to happen, Jock coming and her surprise at seeing
him, and then his telling her... It's awful for Jock... She may know
at half-past five or a bit earlier.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["It's a pity you don't play patience,"]
qText: It's a pity you don't play patience,
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr:
["In a way I shall feel happier when she knows... it feels all wrong as
it is at present, having it as a secret that Brenda doesn't know... I'm
not sure how she fits in her day. I suppose her last lecture is over at
about five... I wonder if she goes home first to change if she's going
out to tea or cocktails. She can't sit about much in the flat, it's so
small."]
qText:
In a way I shall feel happier when she knows... it feels all wrong as
it is at present, having it as a secret that Brenda doesn't know... I'm
not sure how she fits in her day. I suppose her last lecture is over at
about five... I wonder if she goes home first to change if she's going
out to tea or cocktails. She can't sit about much in the flat, it's so
small.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["It's a heart-breaking game,"]
qText: It's a heart-breaking game,
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["Is that only a quarter-past?... You know, I think I should have gone\noff my head if I were alone. It's nice of you to stay with me."]
qText:
Is that only a quarter-past?... You know, I think I should have gone
off my head if I were alone. It's nice of you to stay with me.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Do you play bezique?']
qText: Do you play bezique?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I'm afraid not."]
qText: I'm afraid not.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Or piquet?']
qText: Or piquet?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["No. I've never been able to learn any card game except animal snap."]
qText: No. I've never been able to learn any card game except animal snap.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Pity.']
qText: Pity.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["There's Marjorie and several people I ought to wire to, but I'd better\nwait until I know that Jock has seen Brenda. Suppose she was with\nMarjorie when the telegram arrived."]
qText:
There's Marjorie and several people I ought to wire to, but I'd better
wait until I know that Jock has seen Brenda. Suppose she was with
Marjorie when the telegram arrived.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You've got to try and stop thinking about things. Can you throw craps?"]
qText: You've got to try and stop thinking about things. Can you throw craps?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qText: No.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["That's easy; I'll show you. There'll be some dice in the backgammon\nboard."]
qText:
That's easy; I'll show you. There'll be some dice in the backgammon
board.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I'm all right, really. I'd sooner not play."]
qText: I'm all right, really. I'd sooner not play.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["You get the dice and sit up here at the table. We've got six hours to\nget through."]
qText:
You get the dice and sit up here at the table. We've got six hours to
get through.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I've seen it on the\ncinema--pullman porters and taxi men."]
qText:
I've seen it on the
cinema--pullman porters and taxi men.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Of course you have, it's easy... there you see you've won, you take\nall."]
qText:
Of course you have, it's easy... there you see you've won, you take
all.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I've just thought of something."]
qText: I've just thought of something.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["Don't you ever take a rest from thinking?"]
qText: Don't you ever take a rest from thinking?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ['Suppose the evening papers have got hold of it already. Brenda may\nsee it on a placard, or just pick up a paper casually and there it\nwill be... perhaps with a photograph.']
qText:
Suppose the evening papers have got hold of it already. Brenda may
see it on a placard, or just pick up a paper casually and there it
will be... perhaps with a photograph.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['Yes, I thought of that just now, when you were talking about\ntelegraphing.']
qText:
Yes, I thought of that just now, when you were talking about
telegraphing.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["But it's quite likely, isn't it? They get hold of everything so\nquickly. What can we do about it?"]
qText:
But it's quite likely, isn't it? They get hold of everything so
quickly. What can we do about it?
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["There isn't anything we can do. We've just got to wait... Come on,\nboy, throw up."]
qText:
There isn't anything we can do. We've just got to wait... Come on,
boy, throw up.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I don't want to play any more. I'm worried."]
qText: I don't want to play any more. I'm worried.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ["I know you're worried. You don't have to tell me... you aren't going\nto give up playing just when the luck's running your way?"]
qText:
I know you're worried. You don't have to tell me... you aren't going
to give up playing just when the luck's running your way?
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

qTextArr: ["I'm sorry... it isn't any good."]
qText: I'm sorry... it isn't any good.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr: ['At least we can find out whether the evening\npapers have got it in. We can ring up and ask the hall porter at my\nclub.']
qText:
At least we can find out whether the evening
papers have got it in. We can ring up and ask the hall porter at my
club.
speaker: Tony Last

qTextArr:
['Oh yes,', 'It was. It was _my_ fault. I ought never to have
gone there... a terrible curse hangs over me. Wherever I go I bring
nothing but sorrow... if only it was _I_ that was dead... I shall
never be able to face them again. I feel like a murderess... that brave
little life snuffed out.']
qText:
Oh yes, It was. It was _my_ fault. I ought never to have
gone there... a terrible curse hangs over me. Wherever I go I bring
nothing but sorrow... if only it was _I_ that was dead... I shall
never be able to face them again. I feel like a murderess... that brave
little life snuffed out.

qTextArr:
["That's all right. People are always surprised. I don't see them often.
